How to Identify Your RAM

Method 1: Check the Label

Most RAM modules have a label with key specifications:

  • Memory Type: Look for "DDR3", "DDR4", or "DDR5"
  • Capacity: Usually shown as "4GB", "8GB", "16GB", etc.
  • Speed: Listed as "PC3-12800", "DDR4-3200", or similar
  • Brand: Manufacturer name (Corsair, Kingston, etc.)
üí° Tip: The label is usually on a sticker on the side of the RAM module. If it's hard to read, try taking a photo with your phone's camera for better zoom.

Method 2: Use System Information

Check your computer's system information:

Windows

  1. Press Windows + R, type "msinfo32"
  2. Look for "Installed Physical Memory"
  3. Or use Task Manager ‚Üí Performance ‚Üí Memory

Mac

  1. Apple Menu ‚Üí About This Mac
  2. Click "Memory" tab for details
  3. Or use System Information app

Linux

  1. Terminal: sudo dmidecode -t memory
  2. Or: lshw -short -C memory
  3. GUI: System Monitor ‚Üí Hardware tab

Method 3: Physical Inspection

Identify RAM type by physical characteristics:

DDR3

  • 240 pins (desktop) or 204 pins (laptop)
  • Notch positioned left of center
  • Common speeds: 1333MHz, 1600MHz

DDR4

  • 288 pins (desktop) or 260 pins (laptop)
  • Notch positioned right of center
  • Common speeds: 2133MHz, 2400MHz, 3200MHz

DDR5

  • 288 pins (desktop) or 262 pins (laptop)
  • Different notch position than DDR4
  • Common speeds: 4800MHz, 5600MHz, 6400MHz

Frequently Asked Questions

General Questions

Once we receive and test your RAM modules, payment is processed within 2 business days. We offer PayPal, bank transfer, or check payment options.

If the actual condition or specifications differ from your submission, we'll contact you with a revised offer. You can accept the new price or have your RAM returned at no cost.

We purchase RAM from both individuals and businesses. For bulk quantities over 50 modules, please contact us directly for special pricing and logistics arrangements.

Technical Questions

Yes, but make sure you have replacement RAM or don't need the computer operational. We recommend backing up important data before removing memory modules.

No problem! Use our identification guide above, or select "Unknown" in the form. Our technicians will identify the exact specifications when we receive your modules.

Yes! We purchase ECC (Error-Correcting Code) memory, registered DIMMs, and other server-grade memory. These often have higher value due to specialized applications.

Rank refers to how memory chips are organized on the module. This affects compatibility and performance but doesn't significantly impact resale value for most consumer RAM.

Shipping & Logistics

Use anti-static bags if available, or wrap in aluminum foil. Place in a sturdy box with padding. Avoid bubble wrap directly touching the modules as it can create static.

For orders over $100 estimated value, we provide prepaid shipping labels. For smaller orders, shipping costs are deducted from your final payment.

We recommend using tracked shipping services. If using our prepaid labels, packages are automatically insured. For self-shipped items, consider purchasing insurance.
